intro: Galium pawlowskii, commonly known as the small white bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium pawlowskii is often found in temperate regions and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
